localizedDescriptions.en: Interaction, contact or care event between a subject of care and healthcare provider(s).
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Height, or body length, is measured from crown of head to sole of foot.

annotations.comment: Height is measured with the individual in a standing position and body length in a recumbent position.

localizedDescriptions.en: The length of the body from crown of head to sole of foot.
Measurement of the body weight of an individual.
The weight of the individual.
Calculated measurement which compares a person's weight and height.

annotations.comment: Body Mass Index is a calculated ratio describing how an individual's body weight relates to the weight that is regarded as normal, or desirable, for the individual's height.

localizedDescriptions.en: Index describing ratio of weight to height.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.

annotations.comment: Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.

localizedDescriptions.en: Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.
The position of the individual at the time of measurement.
Standing at the time of blood pressure measurement.
The rate and associated attributes for a pulse or heart beat.
The rate of the pulse or heart beat, measured in beats per minute.
The local measurement of arterial blood pressure which is a surrogate for arterial pressure in the systemic circulation.

annotations.comment: Most commonly, use of the term 'blood pressure' refers to measurement of brachial artery pressure in the upper arm.

localizedDescriptions.en: Peak systemic arterial blood pressure  - measured in systolic or contraction phase of the heart cycle.
Minimum systemic arterial blood pressure - measured in the diastolic or relaxation phase of the heart cycle.
The position of the individual at the time of measurement.
Sitting (for example on bed or chair) at the time of blood pressure measurement.
Lying flat at the time of blood pressure measurement.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Visual acuity is a measure of the spatial resolution of the visual processing system.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Details of the visual field test result for each eye.
The eye which is being examined.
The test result refers to the visual acuity of the left eye only.
The test result refers to the visual acuity of the right eye only.
Details of a visual acuity result recorded using one of the result notation formats.
The distance test result, recorded in Snellen format expressed in metres, where 6/6 is regarded as normal.
The distance test result, recorded as Snellen visual acuity expressed in feet, where 20/20 is regarded as normal.
The distance test result,recorded as Sn ellen visual acuity expressed as a decimal ratio, where 1.0 is regarded as normal.
Visual acuity expressed using ETDRS Letters format, with a value of 100 regarded as normal.
The test result, recorded as logMar visual acuity, where a value of 0 is regarded as normal.
Graded scale used when patient has low levels of visual acuity.
The subject has no perception of light.
The subject can perceive light.
The subject can perceive hand movement.
The subject can count fingers.
Clinical interpretation of all results for the test eye.
No visual acuity test result is available for the test eye.

annotations.comment: Record as True if the clinician was unable to record a result for the test eye.

localizedDescriptions.en: Reason why no visual acuity test result is available for the test eye.

annotations.comment: For example, patient was not cooperative; patient was not capable; ran out of time.

localizedDescriptions.en: Visual acuity status
Individual is registered blind.
Individual is not registered blind.
Individual attends diabetic eye screening.
Individual does not attend diabetic eye screening.
Individual is not required to attend diabetic eye screening.
Individuals right eye is absent.
Individuals left eye is absent.
A generic section header which should be renamed in a template to suit a specific clinical context.
Qualitative and semi-quantitative test array using reagent test strips to indicate possible abnormalities in a sample of urine, often performed as part of Point of Care Testing (POCT).
Detection of glucose in urine sample.
No glucose detected.
Amount equivalent to 1/10 g/dl (100mg/dL or 5 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 1/4 g/dL (250 mg/dL or 15 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 1/2 g/dl (500mg/dL or 30 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 1 g/dl (1000mg/dL or 60 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent >2 g/dl (>2000mg/dL or >120 mmol/L) detected.
Detection of ketones in urine sample.
No ketones detected.
Amount equivalent to 5mg/dL (or 0.5 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 15mg/dL (or 1.5 mmlol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 40mg/dL (or 4.0 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 80mg/dL (or 8.0 mmol/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 160mg/dL (or 16 mmol/L) detected.
Detection of blood in urine sample.
No blood detected.
Trace of non-haemolysed blood detected.
Moderate amount of non-haemolysed blood detected.
Trace of haemolysed blood detected.
Small amount of blood detected.
Moderate amount of blood detected.
Large amount of blood detected.
Detection of protein in urine sample.
No protein detected.
Trace of protein detected.
Amount equivalent to 30mg/dL (or 0.3 g/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 100mg/dL (or 1.0 g/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to 300mg/dL (or 3.0 g/L) detected.
Amount equivalent to >2000mg/dL (or >20 g/L) detected.
Detection of nitrites in urine sample.
No nitrites detected.
Nitrites were detected.
Detection of white blood cells in urine sample.
No leukocytes detected.
Trace detected.
Small amount detected.
Moderate amount detected.
Large amount detected.
To record details of a formal assessment of visual impairment in the UK.
The person has been assessed to not have significant sight impairment.
The person has been assessed to have sigfnificant sight impairment.
The person has been assessed to have severe sight impairment.
